alert.note: Alert for Mahoning (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 5:00PM EDT until September 04 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following county, Mahoning. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Youngstown, Boardman, Campbell, Canfield, Sebring, Austintown, Struthers, Poland, Ellsworth, New Middletown, Lowellville, Beloit, Greenford, Mineral Ridge and Maple Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
